defs.docs:
A build dependency for Cargo libraries to find system artifacts through the
 `pkg-config` utility.

attributes.value: ! A build dependency for Cargo libraries to find system artifacts through the
! `pkg-config` utility.
! This library will shell out to `pkg-config` as part of build scripts and
! probe the system to determine how to link to a specified library. The
! `Config` structure serves as a method of configuring how `pkg-config` is
! invoked in a builder style.
! A number of environment variables are available to globally configure how
! this crate will invoke `pkg-config`:
! * `FOO_NO_PKG_CONFIG` - if set, this will disable running `pkg-config` when
!   probing for the library named `foo`.
! * `PKG_CONFIG_ALLOW_CROSS` - The `pkg-config` command usually doesn't
!   support cross-compilation, and this crate prevents it from selecting
!   incompatible versions of libraries.
!   Setting `PKG_CONFIG_ALLOW_CROSS=1` disables this protection, which is
!   likely to cause linking errors, unless `pkg-config` has been configured
!   to use appropriate sysroot and search paths for the target platform.
! There are also a number of environment variables which can configure how a
! library is linked to (dynamically vs statically). These variables control
! whether the `--static` flag is passed. Note that this behavior can be
! overridden by configuring explicitly on `Config`. The variables are checked
! in the following order:
! * `FOO_STATIC` - pass `--static` for the library `foo`
! * `FOO_DYNAMIC` - do not pass `--static` for the library `foo`
! * `PKG_CONFIG_ALL_STATIC` - pass `--static` for all libraries
! * `PKG_CONFIG_ALL_DYNAMIC` - do not pass `--static` for all libraries
! After running `pkg-config` all appropriate Cargo metadata will be printed on
! stdout if the search was successful.
! # Example
! Find the system library named `foo`, with minimum version 1.2.3:
! ```no_run
! extern crate pkg_config;
! fn main() {
!     pkg_config::Config::new().atleast_version("1.2.3").probe("foo").unwrap();
! Find the system library named `foo`, with no version requirement (not
! recommended):
! ```no_run
! extern crate pkg_config;
! fn main() {
!     pkg_config::probe_library("foo").unwrap();
! Configure how library `foo` is linked to.
! ```no_run
! extern crate pkg_config;
! fn main() {
!     pkg_config::Config::new().atleast_version("1.2.3").statik(true).probe("foo").unwrap();

defs.name: Library
defs.value: Library { libs, link_paths, frameworks, framework_paths, include_paths, defines, version }

defs.name: EnvNoPkgConfig
defs.docs: Aborted because of `*_NO_PKG_CONFIG` environment variable.

attributes.value: / Aborted because of `*_NO_PKG_CONFIG` environment variable.
/ Contains the name of the responsible environment variable.

defs.name: CrossCompilation
defs.docs: Detected cross compilation without a custom sysroot.

attributes.value: / Detected cross compilation without a custom sysroot.
/ Ignore the error with `PKG_CONFIG_ALLOW_CROSS=1`,
/ which may let `pkg-config` select libraries
/ for the host's architecture instead of the target's.

defs.name: Command
defs.docs: Failed to run `pkg-config`.

attributes.value: / Failed to run `pkg-config`.
/ Contains the command and the cause.

defs.name: Failure
defs.docs: `pkg-config` did not exit sucessfully.

attributes.value: / `pkg-config` did not exit sucessfully.
/ Contains the command and output.

defs.name: Error
defs.docs: Represents all reasons `pkg-config` might not succeed or be run at all.

attributes.value: / Represents all reasons `pkg-config` might not succeed or be run at all.

defs.name: find_library
defs.docs: Deprecated in favor of the probe_library function

attributes.value: / Deprecated in favor of the probe_library function

defs.name: probe_library
defs.docs: Simple shortcut for using all default options for finding a library.

attributes.value: / Simple shortcut for using all default options for finding a library.

defs.name: get_variable
defs.docs:
Run `pkg-config` to get the value of a variable from a package using
 `--variable`.

attributes.value: / Run `pkg-config` to get the value of a variable from a package using
/ `--variable`.
/ The content of `PKG_CONFIG_SYSROOT_DIR` is not injected in paths that are
/ returned by `pkg-config --variable`, which makes them unsuitable to use
/ during cross-compilation unless specifically designed to be used
/ at that time.

defs.name: new
defs.docs:
Creates a new set of configuration options which are all initially set
 to "blank".

attributes.value: / Creates a new set of configuration options which are all initially set
/ to "blank".

defs.name: statik
defs.docs: Indicate whether the `--static` flag should be passed.

attributes.value: / Indicate whether the `--static` flag should be passed.
/ This will override the inference from environment variables described in
/ the crate documentation.

defs.name: atleast_version
defs.docs: Indicate that the library must be at least version `vers`.

attributes.value: / Indicate that the library must be at least version `vers`.

defs.name: exactly_version
defs.docs: Indicate that the library must be equal to version `vers`.

attributes.value: / Indicate that the library must be equal to version `vers`.

defs.name: range_version
defs.value: fn <'a, R> (&mut self, range: R) -> &mut Config
defs.docs: Indicate that the library's version must be in `range`.

attributes.value: / Indicate that the library's version must be in `range`.

defs.name: arg
defs.docs: Add an argument to pass to pkg-config.

attributes.value: / Add an argument to pass to pkg-config.
/ It's placed after all of the arguments generated by this library.

defs.name: cargo_metadata
defs.docs:
Define whether metadata should be emitted for cargo allowing it to
 automatically link the binary. Defaults to `true`.

attributes.value: / Define whether metadata should be emitted for cargo allowing it to
/ automatically link the binary. Defaults to `true`.

defs.name: env_metadata
defs.docs:
Define whether metadata should be emitted for cargo allowing to
 automatically rebuild when environment variables change. Defaults to
 `true`.

attributes.value: / Define whether metadata should be emitted for cargo allowing to
/ automatically rebuild when environment variables change. Defaults to
/ `true`.

defs.name: print_system_libs
defs.docs:
Enable or disable the `PKG_CONFIG_ALLOW_SYSTEM_LIBS` environment
 variable.

attributes.value: / Enable or disable the `PKG_CONFIG_ALLOW_SYSTEM_LIBS` environment
/ variable.
/ This env var is enabled by default.

defs.name: print_system_cflags
defs.docs:
Enable or disable the `PKG_CONFIG_ALLOW_SYSTEM_CFLAGS` environment
 variable.

attributes.value: / Enable or disable the `PKG_CONFIG_ALLOW_SYSTEM_CFLAGS` environment
/ variable.
/ This env var is enabled by default.

defs.name: probe
defs.docs: Run `pkg-config` to find the library `name`.

attributes.value: / Run `pkg-config` to find the library `name`.
/ This will use all configuration previously set to specify how
/ `pkg-config` is run.
